required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Non-Interventional Study With Spiriva Respimat in COPD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Physical Activity (PF10 Sub Domain of SF-36 Activity Score) and Tolerability in COPD Patients During Treatment With Spiriva® Respimat®

brief_summary.textblock: This observational non-interventional study is designed to demonstrate the improvement of physical function in COPD patients on treatment with Spiriva Respimat and allows adverse events to be recorded and evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Therapeutic Success as Change From Baseline in Physical Functioning After 6 Weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Main efficacy measure was therapeutic success rate defined as an improvement from baseline after 6 weeks by at least 10 score points in the PF-10 (subdomain of SF-36) score (range from 0 to 100, 0 reflects worst and 100 best condition)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the PF-10 Score After 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical changes in physical functioning (PF-10) after 6 weeks of treatment. PF-10 (subdomain of SF-36) score (range from 0 to 100, 0 reflects worst and 100 best condition)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline After 6 Weeks in Physician's Global Evaluation (PGE) Form Safety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in Physician's Global Evaluation in physical functioning from baseline after 6 weeks of treatment (measured as 8 point scale with classifications "poor" (1, 2), "satisfactory" (3, 4), "good" (5, 6), and "excellent" (7, 8))

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients' Satisfaction After 6 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' satisfaction with the Spiriva® Respimat® device after 6 weeks of treatment ("very satisfied", "satisfied", "rather satisfied", "neither satisfied nor "unsatisfied", "rather unsatisfied", "unsatisfied", and "very unsatisfied")

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
COPD patients who require treatment with longacting anticholinergic
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients cannot be recruited if any of the general or specific contraindications listed in the Patient information leaflet or the Summary of Product Characteristics applies. Spiriva® Respimat® is contraindicated in patients with hypersensitivity to tiotropium bromide, atropine or its derivatives, e.g. ipratropium or oxitropium or to any of the excipients.

group.title: Spiriva® Respimat® 2 Puffs Once Daily at the Same Time
Spiriva® Respimat® 2 Puffs Once Daily at the Same Time

outcome.title: Therapeutic Success as Change From Baseline in Physical Functioning After 6 Weeks
outcome.description: Main efficacy measure was therapeutic success rate defined as an improvement from baseline after 6 weeks by at least 10 score points in the PF-10 (subdomain of SF-36) score (range from 0 to 100, 0 reflects worst and 100 best condition)
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: There were 1230 patients who had evaluable PF-10 measurement at both baseline and after 6 weeks

reported_events.desc: There were 1280 patients in the safety population

group.title: Spiriva® Respimat® 2 Puffs Once Daily at the Same Time

event.sub_title: Bronchitis, Infective exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease, Urinary tract infection

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Bronchial carcinoma, Laryngeal cancer, Metastatic renal cell carcinoma

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
